bibl.title: Snippets from the Past. Two Ancient Sites in the Asyut Region: Dayr al-Gabrawi and Dayr al-‘Izam.
bibl.note: Asyut / Lykopolis in Late Antiquity. - Dayr al-Gabrawi: The Martyrium of St. Victor the General? - Dayr al-‘Izam: The Hermitage of John of Lykopolis. - Conclusions. - Pp. 167-168: Appendix: The Jar from Dayr al-‘Izam [S.B. Kopt. I, 299].

bibl.title: Christianity and Monasticism in Middle Egypt. Al-Minya and Asyut.

bibl.seg: Jacques van der Vliet, Snippets from the Past. Two Ancient Sites in the Asyut Region: Dayr al-Gabrawi and Dayr al-‘Izam.
Gawdat Gabra & Hany N. Takla (edd.), Christianity and Monasticism in Middle Egypt. Al-Minya and Asyut (Cairo - New York, 2015) pp. 161-168.

Asyut / Lykopolis in Late Antiquity. - Dayr al-Gabrawi: The Martyrium of St. Victor the General? - Dayr al-‘Izam: The Hermitage of John of Lykopolis. - Conclusions. - Pp. 167-168: Appendix: The Jar from Dayr al-‘Izam [S.B. Kopt. I, 299].
